meanings.definition: The act of imposing something again.
meanings.sent1: The reimposition of rules caused confusion in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The government announced the reimposition of a tax on imported goods.
meanings.sent3: The reimposition of bedtime made the children groan.
meanings.sent4: The reimposition of silence in the library was like a sudden storm.
meanings.sent5: The reimposition of the curfew was met with protests from the community.

meanings.definition: The state of being imposed again.
meanings.sent1: After the reimposition of the curfew, the streets were deserted.
meanings.sent2: The reimposition of restrictions led to frustration among the citizens.
meanings.sent3: The reimposition of the dress code made everyone look like clones.
meanings.sent4: The reimposition of the ban felt like a heavy weight on their shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The reimposition of the speed limit slowed down traffic significantly.
